conclusion: After the metal slab is pulled out, the electric‐field magnitude in the region where the particle is located returns to the uniform value E = V / d.
The value E = V / d exists between the plates when no slab is present.
The charged particle of charge q and mass m experiences an electric force Fₑ = qE = q V / d.
The net force on the particle is the vector sum of the electric force and its weight, mg.
Taking the upward direction as positive, the net force is F_net = q V / d − mg.
The particle’s acceleration is a = F_net / m = ( q V / d − mg ) / m.
The particle’s acceleration simplifies to a = q V / (m d) − g.
Once the metal plate is withdrawn, the particle’s acceleration is a = (q V)/(m d) − g.
